intro: Doemia linearis, commonly known as the slender doemia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
